title: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data
text: goal treasury provide simple modern interface US treasury XML feed daily interest rates.

title: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data
text: can install released version treasury CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data
text: treasury functions prefixed tr_ follow naming convention XML feed.
code: library(treasury)  yield_curve <- tr_yield_curve(2023) head(yield_curve) #>          date maturity  rate #>        <Date>   <char> <num> #> 1: 2023-01-03  1 month  4.17 #> 2: 2023-01-03  2 month  4.42 #> 3: 2023-01-03  3 month  4.53 #> 4: 2023-01-03  4 month  4.70 #> 5: 2023-01-03  6 month  4.77 #> 6: 2023-01-03   1 year  4.72

title: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: rates daily secondary market quotations recently auctioned Treasury Bills maturity tranche (4-week, 8-week, 13-week, 17-week, 26-week, 52-week) Treasury currently issues new bills.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: https://home.treasury.gov/treasury-daily-interest-rate-xml-feed

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: date (character(1) | numeric(1)) date format yyyy yyyymm. NULL, data returned. Default NULL.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: data.table::data.table() containing rates NULL entries found.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: Market quotations obtained approximately 3:30 PM business day Federal Reserve Bank New York. Bank Discount rate rate bill quoted secondary market based par value, amount discount 360-day year. Coupon Equivalent, also called Bond Equivalent, Investment Yield, bill's yield based purchase price, discount, 365- 366-day year. Coupon Equivalent can used compare yield discount bill yield nominal coupon security pays semiannual interest maturity date.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
code: # \donttest{ # get data for a single month tr_bill_rates("202201") #>            date   type maturity value #>          <Date> <char>   <char> <num> #>   1: 2022-01-03  close  4 weeks  0.05 #>   2: 2022-01-03  yield  4 weeks  0.05 #>   3: 2022-01-03  close  8 weeks  0.06 #>   4: 2022-01-03  yield  8 weeks  0.06 #>   5: 2022-01-03  close 13 weeks  0.09 #>  ---                                  #> 196: 2022-01-31  yield 13 weeks  0.24 #> 197: 2022-01-31  close 26 weeks  0.49 #> 198: 2022-01-31  yield 26 weeks  0.50 #> 199: 2022-01-31  close 52 weeks  0.76 #> 200: 2022-01-31  yield 52 weeks  0.77 # or for the entire year tr_bill_rates(2022) #>             date   type maturity value #>           <Date> <char>   <char> <num> #>    1: 2022-01-03  close  4 weeks  0.05 #>    2: 2022-01-03  yield  4 weeks  0.05 #>    3: 2022-01-03  close  8 weeks  0.06 #>    4: 2022-01-03  yield  8 weeks  0.06 #>    5: 2022-01-03  close 13 weeks  0.09 #>   ---                                  #> 2586: 2022-12-30  yield 17 weeks  4.70 #> 2587: 2022-12-30  close 26 weeks  4.60 #> 2588: 2022-12-30  yield 26 weeks  4.77 #> 2589: 2022-12-30  close 52 weeks  4.51 #> 2590: 2022-12-30  yield 52 weeks  4.73 # }

what: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
title: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
text: Yield Curve Treasury Nominal Coupon Issues (TNC yield curve) derived Treasury nominal notes bonds. Yield Curve Treasury Real Coupon Issues (TRC yield curve) derived Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities (TIPS). Treasury Breakeven Inflation Curve (TBI curve) derived TNC TRC yield curves combined.

title: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
code: tr_curve_rate(   x = c("hqm", "tnc", "trc", "tbi"),   type = c("monthly", "end-of-month"),   year = NULL )  tr_par_yields(x = c("hqm", "tnc", "trc"), type = c("monthly", "end-of-month"))  tr_forward_rate(   x = c("tnc", "trc", "tbi"),   type = c("monthly", "end-of-month") )

title: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
text: https://home.treasury.gov/data/treasury-coupon-issues--corporate-bond-yield-curves

title: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
text: x (character(1)) one following options: "hqm": Treasury High Quality Market (HQM) Corporate Bond Yield Curve. "tnc": Treasury Nominal Coupon-Issue (TNC) Yield Curve. "trc": Treasury Real Coupon-Issue (TRC) Yield Curve. "tbi": Treasury Breakeven Inflation (TBI) Curve. type (character(1)) either "monthly" "end--month". Default "monthly". year (integer(1)) year download. Default NULL. NULL, available years downloaded.

title: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
text: data.table::data.table() containing treasury rates.

title: Download Treasury Coupon Issues and Corporate Bond Yield Curves — tr_curve_rate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # TBI Treasury Curve Breakeven Rates tr_curve_rate("tbi") tr_curve_rate("trc", "end-of-month", 2024L) # TRC Treasury Yield Curve Par Yields, Monthly Average tr_par_yields("trc") # TNC Treasury Yield Curve Forward Rates, End of Month tr_forward_rate("tnc", "end-of-month") } # }

title: Daily treasury long-term rates — tr_long_term_rate
text: Treasury ceased publication 30-year constant maturity series February 18, 2002 resumed series February 9, 2006. estimate 30-year rate time frame, series includes Treasury 20-year Constant Maturity rate "adjustment factor," may added 20-year rate estimate 30-year rate period time Treasury issue 30-year bonds.

what: Daily treasury par real yield curve rates — tr_real_yield_curve
title: Daily treasury par real yield curve rates — tr_real_yield_curve
text: par real curve, relates par real yield Treasury Inflation Protected Security (TIPS) time maturity, based closing market bid prices recently auctioned TIPS --counter market. par real yields derived input market prices, indicative quotations obtained Federal Reserve Bank New York approximately 3:30 PM business day. Treasury began publishing series January 2, 2004. time Treasury released 1 year historical data.

what: treasury: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data — treasury-package
title: treasury: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data — treasury-package
text: Download daily interest rates US Treasury XML feed. Leveraging https://home.treasury.gov/treasury-daily-interest-rate-xml-feed, package serves wrapper, facilitating retrieval daily treasury rates across various categories, including par yield curves, treasury bills, long-term rates, real yield curves.

title: treasury: Client for US Treasury XML Feed and Published Data — treasury-package
text: Maintainer: Maximilian Mücke muecke.maximilian@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: treasury (development version)
text: Migration data.table package. Internal data manipulation now done using data.table functions return data.table objects.

title: treasury 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-05 Better docs Support Treasury High Quality Market (HQM) Corporate Bond Yield Curve data Support Treasury Nominal Coupon-Issue (TNC) Yield Curve data Support Treasury Real Coupon-Issue (TRC) Yield Curve data Support Treasury Breakeven Inflation Curve (TBI curve) data
